title: >>> The LUCKY "7"
body_text:
Saving Seven
DODGEBALL 47 ... on 7.7.06 ... with a winning score of 7 to 5 ...
She did it again ladies and gentleman, retaining the precious "title" that is the captains crown.
Sara DeCuir's win streak remains in-tact after the defeat of Derek Carty at the first July 2006 event just days ago. It was an all-out war that could have easily gone either way. In one of the closest matches in history, Derek fought as hard as possible, as did his team, to capture the gold. But the victory was null and void as the most dominant female in dodgeball today secured her second straight win ...
Everything was going fine for Derek up until the final hour of play. The score was dead-even at 4 apiece and you can bet both captains could taste the victory. However, this final hour caused the downfall of Derek and his team as they secured only one win compared to Sara's three. It was the nail in the coffin for one Derek Carty.
Sara DeCuir retains the Captains Crown, defeating Derek Carty at DODGEBALL 47.
And then there were THREE
Sara's captains win at 47 was a crucial victory, especially with DODGEBALL 50 less than a month away. It is now understood that only three players have the chance to walk into DODGEBALL 50 as the champ.
Sara is the reigning champion, with her next opponent the incomparable Kevin Adams at DODGEBALL 48. The winner of that match will unquestionably earn their way into 50 if they can then defeat John Tronolone at DODGEBALL 49.
Sara, Kevin, John ... Who's going to 50?
Solid Start in July
> Attendance: 21
> New Players: (1) Mike Edwards
> Biggest Return: Lauren Winston (Last played at DODGEBALL 42)
> DODGEBALL 47 marked the fourth consecutive time the WHS Back courts were used. This record continued from last week.
> Lenny Herrera missed his very first event. His incredible streak ran from DODGEBALL XONE on November 4th to last week's event, DODGEBALL 46.
> Once again it is Sara DeCuir who remains on top of the dodgeball world with a victory over Derek Carty. Sara's record improves to 2-2. Derek however has yet to see his first win. He is 0-3.
To Be the Best
After jokingly claiming to the be the MVP of the event, one can only wonder if it was meant to be a joke at all. Either way, Melissa Kerr was right. She was one of the standout performers on her debut night at DODGEBALL XL and since then has rose above the ranks quicker than perhaps any other female. Her "trademarked" split-legged dodge keeps her in the games for an extended period of time. Her arm is very powerful as well, knocking down anyone she wants to at any given time. Follow that up with the gift of catching and you have a legend in the making.
For the men, Mike Edwards easily set the standard at DODGEBALL 47. So few players can make an impact as significant as he on their debut night. It was the fundamental skills that earned him the respect of his peers: aerial dodges, a rocket-fueled arm, and sticky hands for catching. An impressive debut to say the least.
In a rare occurance, John Tronolone managed to hit rim five times during the event.
Ryan Letsche has to be one of the most underrated talents on the current "roster". His performance at DODGEBALL 47 perhaps silenced the doubters. His accuracy for the event may have been sharper than anyone else. With a keen eye on oncoming balls, his ability to dodge, whether low to the ground or high in the air, further illustrates his will to succeed.
________________________________________
_____________
Sara DeCuir vs. Kevin Adams ... all on
The Road to 50
!
